content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler and Joey are playing with the duck and the chick.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, wouldn’t be cool if our duck and chick had a little baby? We could call it Chuck.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Or… Dick.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Listen, I-I need a favor. Umm, I was in the shower, and as I was cleansing myself, I ah, I-I, well I felt something.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Was it like a sneeze only better?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, I mean, I mean a thing on my body.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What was it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I don’t know, it’s-it’s kinda in a place that’s not… It’s not visually accessible to me, and I was hoping maybe you guys could-could help me out. (starts to take off his pants)

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: Whoa!!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on you guys, it’s no big deal! (He turns around and shows him his thing.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whoa-heeeiiiiii-iiiii-ah!! (sees it) Huh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well what is it? Is it a mole? (He moves closer to them, and they jump back.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, it’s too wrinkly to be a mole.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, eww. What? Is it a pimple?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, it’s… fancier than a pimple. Look Ross, why don’t you just go see a…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey guys! What’s… (sees what they’re doing and stops, the guys are stunned)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, well, it’s definite, two more weeks of winter.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ahhh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, right.
(Rachel backs out with a confused look on her face.)

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Joey, and Rachel are there, as Phoebe enters with her date.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, and then this is the coffee house. This is where I play my music. (points to the stage)

content.speaker: Vince
content.text: Good deal.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, and these are my friends. People. This is Vince, Vince the people.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Vince
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Vince is a fireman.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! Have you ever rescued anyone from a burning building before?

content.speaker: Vince
content.text: 98 hot saves, highest in the force.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, y’know if Joey and I played with matches we could get you up to an even hundred.

content.speaker: Vince
content.text: Fire safety is not a joke, son.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re right, I know.

content.speaker: Vince
content.text: Look, I gotta go. I’m on call tonight. (kisses her) See you Saturday. (leaves)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (watches him leave)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow, he’s cute, Pheebs! But I thought you just started dating that Kindergarten teacher.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, Jason? Yeah, uh-huh, we’re seeing each other tonight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What-Pheebs?! Two dates in one day? That’s so unlike you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know, I know! I’m like playing the field. Y’know? Like, juggling two guys, I’m sowing my wild oats. Y’know? Y’know, this kind’ve like y’know oat-sowin’, field-playin’ juggler.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So Pheebs, do they know about each other?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Does a dog’s lips move when he reads? (Joey makes an `I don’t know’ face, and looks to Chandler and Rachel, who’re also stumped) Okay, no they don’t.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey guys!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!
(He goes over and sits down at the counter, all depressed.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, how’d it go at the doctor’s?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, he said there’s definitely nothing to worry about, it’s totally benign.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well what is it?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He couldn’t even tell me! He said it was just some sort of skin… abnormality. And the worst thing is he-he-he said, he said, without being able to identify it, he was reluctant to remove it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what? You should go to my guy, because when I went in there with my third nipple. He just lopped it right off. Y’know? So I guess I’m lucky. I mean not as lucky as people who were born with two nipples.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: At least they knew what yours was. Y’know, yours had a name.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh! Maybe they’ll name yours after you! Y’know, they’ll call it, The Ross. And then people would be like, "Awww, he’s got a Ross."

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, that’d be cool!
[cut to Phoebe and Rachel as Monica returns from the bathroom]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Pete’s breaking up with me.

content.speaker: All
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I just checked my messages, and he said that when he gets back from Atlanta, we need to talk.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well that’s it. People never say `We need to talk’ unless it’s something bad.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa, that doesn’t necessarily mean that he’s breaking up with you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, maybe he just cheated on you.

content.description: A Street, Phoebe is walking with her second date, Jason.

content.speaker: Jason
content.text: …and I know I’ll never miss doing it, but I gotta tell you, it’s pretty cool knowing that you’re making a difference in a kid’s life.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That is so great! Oh, I… (sees that a parked near them has caught on fire) Oh my God!

content.speaker: Jason
content.text: Whoa!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!!!

content.speaker: Jason
content.text: Ahh-ahh, we’d better call the fire department!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! No!

content.speaker: Jason
content.text: No, no?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, we don’t n-n-n-n-need a fireman, we’d, we’d like a good mechanic. (hears the sound of approaching sirens) Oh my God, here they come! Well, we gotta get out of here!

content.speaker: Jason
content.text: W-w-w-wait! Why?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well look, if I wanted to see a fireman, I would date one. Okay? (she drags him away)

content.description: A Doctor’s Office, Ross is having his thing looked at by Dr. Rhodes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Th-th-that’s all it is, a third nipple. Y’know? Just your run-of-the-mill third nipple. Y’know? You can take it off. Just slice that baby right off!

content.speaker: Dr. Rhodes
content.text: Take your shirt off, and let’s see what we’re dealing with here. (Ross starts to take off his pants) What are you doing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Just showing you my run-of-the-mill-slice-it-right-off third nipple.

content.speaker: Dr. Rhodes
content.text: Well that’s not a third nipple.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No?

content.speaker: Dr. Rhodes
content.text: First of all, it’s on your ass.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well then, what is it?!

content.speaker: Dr. Rhodes
content.text: Wait a minute, hold it. (He goes to the door and opens it.) Johnson! Will you come in here a moment?

content.speaker: Dr. Johnson
content.text: I’m with Hamilton!

content.speaker: Dr. Rhodes
content.text: He’s good with rear things, bring him in too.

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, and Joey are there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I gotta go water Pete’s plants. (stops) Y’know what, if he’s gonna break up with me, maybe I won’t water his plants.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, if he’s gonna break up with you, maybe Joey and I should water his plants. If y’know what I mean.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Or ha-ha, we could go over there and pee on them.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: …and I-I can’t take it! Y’know? I’m just, always afraid one of them is gonna catch me with the other one. It’s making me crazy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well honey, then why don’t you break up with one of them?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa. What ah, what happened to playing the field?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, it just, it doesn’t feel like playing anymore, it feels like work. It’s like I’m working in the field.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So Pheebs, pick one of them.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. Which one do you like more?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, Vince is great, y’know `cause, he’s like a guy, guy. Y’know? He’s so burly, he’s sooo very burly. (giggles)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, good, so there you go. Go with Vince.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but Jason’s really sensitive.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well sensitive is important, pick him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh sure, go with the sissy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Jason is not a sissy!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh no-no-no-no, I meant Chandler.

content.description: Dr. Rhodes’s Office, a rather large group of doctors has now gathered to take a look at Ross’s thing. Ross is none too pleased with the developments, he has a disgusted look on his face.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know I have dinner plans!!

content.speaker: Dr. Rhodes
content.text: Thank you soo much for coming on such a short notice. Ladies and gentlemen, I’ve-I’ve-I’ve been practicing medicine for twenty-three years, and I’m stumped.
(He removes the blanket covering the thing.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Whoa. (they all lean in to get a closer look, Ross isn’t pleased)

content.description: Pete’s apartment, Monica is there to water the plants, and is showing the gang around.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, this is the den. All right, check this out. Lights! (the lights turn on automatically, but are very bright) Whoa! All right. Less lights! Bad lights! Lights go away! (they dim) Oh, see you just need to find the right command.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, and the dimmer switch.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa! For a rich guy he’s got, that’s a pretty small TV.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No-no-no, that’s a video-phone. But hey guys you’re not supposed to be here, so please, do not touch anything.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I-kea! This is comfortable.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: This place is amazing.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: God, that is the nicest kitchen.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! But it’s the nicest kitchen, the refrigerator told me to have a great day.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look at this! A millionaire’s checkbook.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, put that down! (the phone rings) Oh my God! It’s Pete. Okay, get out!! How the hell do you answer a video-phone! (steps in front of it, and automatically answers it)

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Monica? (the gang ducks and hides)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I guess that’s how.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Hey Monica, how’s it going.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh it’s umm, good! It’s umm, it’s good, just here watering the plants.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Well don’t forget that fiches over there by Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ahh… Chandler’s on the couch!!

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: I see him, you guys are just the worst hiders ever.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey Pete.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi, how ya doing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ahh, Pete, the other day when you said you needed to talk, umm, just so I know, is it good news or bad news.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Oh, it’s good news. No, it’s definitely good news. Hold on a second, I have another call. (clicks his remote) (to his other call) Hey, how’s it going?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no-no-no, it’s still me.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Ah, no it’s not. I’ve got picture-in-picture here. (to other caller) Yeah. (listens) Yeah, okay. I’m gonna have to call you back later. (pause) Monica? You. I’m gonna have to call you back.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, oh, okay umm, so I’ll see you soon.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Okay, I love you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I love you.

content.speaker: All
content.text: I love you, love you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. Well, it’s good news. It’s good news.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, what do you thing the good news is?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! Look at this! He wrote a check for 50,000 dollars to Hugo Ligrens Ring Design. (Monica is stunned) Oh, sorry, what do you think the good news is?
[pause]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica’s gonna marry a millionaire!!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, you gotta get Mom on the phone. Call Mom! Call Mom!
(Pete’s computer automatically calls Mom, Pete’s Mom.)

content.speaker: Pete’s Mom
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And that’s Pete’s Mom.
(The gang quickly hides again.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the gang is returning from Pete’s.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Mon you definitely have to make it a theme wedding, and the theme could be, “Look how much money we’ve got!” Y’know, I mean you could put, you could put money in-in the invitations! You-you could have like little money place settings. And ah, you could start with a money salad! I mean it’ll be dry, but people will like it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Would you stop? We’ve only been going out a couple of weeks, I mean we don’t even know if he’s gonna propose.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, but this is Pete. Okay? He’s not like other people, on your first date he took you to Rome. For most guys that’s like a third or fourth date kinda thing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well if-if that’s what it is, then it’s-it’s crazy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica’s right. We’re talking about getting married here. Okay? She-she can’t just rush into this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh please, what do you know! You married a lesbian!
(Joey laughs, Ross glares at him, and Joey stops.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right. I gotta go. I have break up with Vince.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, so you’re going with the teacher, huh?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I like Vince a lot, y’know? But, it’s just Jason’s so sensitive, y’know? And in the long run, I think sensitive it’s just better than having just like a really, really, really nice (pause) butt. (Her eyes glaze over thinking about the butt.) (pause) Jason! Definitely Jason! Okay, wish me luck!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Good luck!
(pause)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OH MY GOD!!! (She holds her hands up in triumph and the gang all look at her.) Sorry, I was just imagining what it’d be like to catch the money bouquet.

content.description: A Fire House, Phoebe has gone to break up with Vince.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Excuse me. Umm, is Vince here?

content.speaker: Fireman
content.text: Oh sure. Vince?!

content.speaker: Vince
content.text: Yo!! (slides down that pole that fire station’s have)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! I didn’t know you guys actually used those.

content.speaker: Vince
content.text: So, what’s up?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, wow. This-this isn’t gonna be easy. Umm, I don’t think we should see each other anymore.

content.speaker: Vince
content.text: Uh-huh. G-good deal.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Vince
content.text: No-no it’s okay. It’s just that ah, I thought we had something pretty special here. And y’know I-I felt like you were someone I could finally open up to, and… (starts choking up) That there’s so much in me I have to share with you yet.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God, I didn’t…

content.speaker: Vince
content.text: I’m sorry, I can’t talk. I’m gonna go write in my journal. (walks away)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait-wait-wait! Wait!!

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe, Ross, and Monica are there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m telling you, if you want to take care of that thing, you should go to my herbal guy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you, but I want to remove it Pheebs. I don’t want to make it savory.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know when girls sleep with guys with weird things on their body, they tell their friends about it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Gimme this. (Grabs the herbalist’s card and leaves.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Okay, don’t be mad at me, but I couldn’t resist.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Brides magazines?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, and I know that you’d say no if he asked you, but I’m sorry; how great would you look walking down the aisle in this Donna Carin. (shows her the picture.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, you so would! Oh, you should get that anyway. (They both look at her.) Like for clubbing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It is so weird, I know what I said, but uh, this morning, I was lying in bed I was, I was imagining what it would be like to say yes. (Rachel slams the magazine shut in amazement.) I know it’s a little sudden, and it’s a little rushed, and it’s totally not like me to do something like this, but that doesn’t mean I can’t. Right? I mean I’m-I’m crazy about Pete, and I know that we want the same things, and when I thought about saying yes, it made me really happy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God. (starting to cry)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know. (pause) I need more pie. (goes and gets some)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey Mon umm, if you do get married, can I bring two guests?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You didn’t break up with that fireman?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, that was my way of telling you. Well, it turns out he’s incredibly sensitive, he keeps a journal and he paints. He even showed me charcoal drawings that he drew of me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, well he’d prefer water colors, but y’know, he has easy access to a lot of charcoal.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So then, are you going to dump Jason?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, yeah, because I have to break up with someone, and… Okay so Jason is sensitive, (holds up one finger) but now so’s Vince (holds up one finger on her other hand) Plus, Vince has the body y’know? (holds up two more fingers on the Vince side) So… It’s really just about the math.

content.description: Jason’s apartment, Phoebe has gone to break up with Jason.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Jason?

content.speaker: Jason
content.text: Yeah, come on in.
(She goes in, and sees Jason without his shirt. It turns out that he has a great body too, and is at a loss for words.)

content.speaker: Jason
content.text: So Phoebe, you ah, sounded kinda serious on the phone, is ah, is anything wrong?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nah-ha!

content.description: Phoebe’s Herbal Guy’s office, Ross is there about his thing. Ross is looking around the exam room, and he goes over to a large bank of drawers, pulls one out and almost spills it as the herbalist, Guru Saj, enters.

content.speaker: Guru Saj
content.text: You must be Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Guru Saj
content.text: I am Guru Saj. (takes the drawer back and replaces)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Listen, I got to tell you I’ve-I’ve never been to a guru before, so…

content.speaker: Guru Saj
content.text: Well, relax. If it makes you feel better, I’ve attended some of the finest medical schools in Central America. Well then, let’s take a look at this skin abnormality of yours. (motions to the table) Come on, have a seat. (looks at it) Eeh, huh. As I suspected, it’s a koondis!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s a koondis?

content.speaker: Guru Saj
content.text: I don’t know, what’s a koondis with you? (starts laughing as if that joke was funny, Ross only looks at him, and he stops) Please, lie down! I’ve got a save that oughta shrink that right up.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I guess it’s worth a try.

content.speaker: Guru Saj
content.text: Oh sure, we should see results—Whoa!! Clearly not the way to go!! (quickly wipes it off)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! What?!

content.speaker: Guru Saj
content.text: We appear to have angered it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We?! We angered it?!

content.speaker: Guru Saj
content.text: Oh, I think I see the problem. And I’m afraid we’re gonna have to use a much stronger tool. (Ross gives him a ‘What?’ look) Love.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh God!

content.speaker: Guru Saj
content.text: Ross, there is absolutely no way this is going to come off unless you start to…
content.parenthetical: He starts moving his hands around in circles above the thing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ow!!

content.speaker: Guru Saj
content.text: Oops.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What was, what was that?

content.speaker: Guru Saj
content.text: Well it’s gone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! How’s that?

content.speaker: Guru Saj
content.text: It got caught on my watch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! (congratulates him)

content.description: Pete’s apartment, Pete and Monica are coming back from a date.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Lights. (The lights turn on, once again they’re too bright.) Uh, romantic lights. (The lights dim.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ooh, nice.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: So ah, there was this thing I wanted to talk to you about.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, right! I completely forgot about that.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Well ah, I’ve been doing a lot of thinking, and I look at my life…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: And I feel like I’ve conquered the business world, and I feel like I’ve conquered the intellectual world, and now I-I have the most beautiful woman in the world.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: There’s one thing missing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s that?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: It’s time for me to conquer the physical world.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (not sure of herself)

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Monica, I want to become (pause) the Ultimate Fighting Champion.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You wanna what?!

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: I want to become the Ultimate Fighting Champion! It’s the most intense physical competition in the world, it’s banned in 49 states!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you talking about?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Okay, my trainer, Ho Chi, is teaching me a combination of Gee Koon Doe and Brazilian street fighting, I’ve even had my own octagon training ring designed.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And I suppose you used a ring designer for that.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Yeah. Monica, I want you there in the front row when I win. I want you close enough to smell the blood. What do you think?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: My parents will be so happy.

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe’s singing, Vince is also there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: “Crazy underwear, creepin’ up my butt. (Jason enters) Crazy underwear, always in a rut. Crazy under-(sees Jason)-wear…” (In her head) Oh No! What is he doing here? All right, just keep playing, just keep playing. You’ll get through this; you’ll be fine. (She tries to continue the song, but she has lost the ability to pronounce words, and the lyrics come out as gibberish.) (giving up on the song) Okay, thank you. And, as always no one talk to me after the show.
(They all applaud her.)

content.speaker: Jason
content.text: Hey. I was…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Jason
content.text: I was passin’ by and I saw that you were playing tonight, it’s kinda cool seeing you up there. (kisses her)

content.speaker: Vince
content.text: Whoa! Hey-hey! What’s going on here? Who is this guy?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know, he just started kissing me. Get him! Get him, Vince!

content.speaker: Vince
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Jason
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, okay, I’ve-I’ve been dating both of you, and it’s been really horrible. ‘Cause y’know it’s been a lot of fun, for me. Umm, but I-I like you both, and I, and I didn’t know how to chose, so… I’m sorry, I’m just, I’m terrible, I’m a terrible person. I’m terrible.

content.speaker: Vince
content.text: Phoebe, Phoebe relax, it’s okay. I mean we never said this was exclusive.

content.speaker: Jason
content.text: Yeah, and neither did we. Give yourself a break.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Jason
content.text: Yeah. I mean y’know, we haven’t been going out that long. Come on, we haven’t even slept together yet. Huh.

content.speaker: Vince
content.text: You haven’t?

content.speaker: Jason
content.text: You have?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, this is none of my business. (starts to walk away)

content.speaker: Jason
content.text: I-I can’t believe this! You-you’ve slept with him?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I made you a candle light dinner in the park.

content.speaker: Jason
content.text: Y’know Phoebe, I’m gonna make this real easy for you. (walks out)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, that could’ve been really awkward.

content.speaker: Vince
content.text: You made him a candle light dinner in the park?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but I-I-I-I can do that for you, I’m gonna do that for you.

content.speaker: Vince
content.text: Uh yeah, I can’t believe I ever went out with somebody who would actually have an open flame in the middle of a wooden area. (walks out)

content.description: Guru Saj’s office: Joey and Chandler have taken the duck to see the guru.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Everything’s gonna be all right. Okay, Dick?

content.speaker: Guru Saj
content.text: Hello, I am Guru Saj-(sees the duck)-Whoa!! (to Joey) That’s supposed to be a duck right? ‘Cause otherwise, this is waaay out of my league.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, yeah. He’s got a, he’s got a really bad cough, and our vet, he can’t do anything about it. Is there something you can do?

content.speaker: Guru Saj
content.text: Hmm, let me see. Let me see. Do you think you could get him to eat a bat?
(The duck starts to frantically flap his wings, while Joey is holding him, in an attempt to get away.)
